cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.current_location: about 65 mi NNE of Puerto Plata, Dominican Republic and 70 mi SE of Grand Turk Island
cyclone.trajectory: continuing WNW across the Turks & Caicos and Bahamas, then bending northwest toward the Florida Keys and the south-east Florida coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: South Florida / Florida Keys (near or just south-west of Port Everglades, FL)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Jupiter Inlet southward around the Florida peninsula to Bonita Beach, including the Florida Keys, Lake Okeechobee and Florida Bay
weather_observation.warning_coast: Dominican Republic, Haiti, Turks & Caicos, Southeastern-Central-Northwestern Bahamas (no Florida warnings yet)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeast Florida coastline (Palm Beach, Broward, Miami-Dade), Florida Keys, Southwest Florida coast
weather_observation.wind: High likelihood (70% cumulative) of sustained 50-kt winds with hurricane-force gusts possible late Saturday night through Sunday night
weather_observation.storm_surge: Storm-surge watch posted; 5–10 ft inundation possible along southeast Florida including Port Everglades if the eye tracks just offshore/onshore during high tide
weather_observation.rainfall: 8–12 inches with isolated totals up to 20 inches forecast for southeast Florida, producing flash-flood potential on port facilities
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf, life-threatening rip currents, and possible coastal erosion that can impact berth structures and channel approaches
